featureSplit

Class RandomSplit

  • java.lang.Object
    • featureSplit.RandomSplit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SplitterIF

    public class RandomSplit
extends java.lang.Object
implements SplitterIF
    Creates a balanced random split of features in two views. Balanced split - views have the same number of features.

        public FeatureSplit splitDatasets(FeatureGraph graph,
                                  CoTrainingData data,
                                  java.util.Random rand,

                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a balanced random split of features in two views. Balanced split - views have the same number of features.
        Specified by:
        splitDatasets in interface SplitterIF
        Parameters:
        graph - this parameter is ignored - random feature split does not rely on a certain measure so it does not need a graph
        data - data to split in the views
        rand - an instance of random number generator to use
        splitNo - the number of split
        Returns:
        the feature split
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there was an error creating the split
